20110121181031.000|20110121181034.000|TR0|is going to India; this is going to Saudi

20110121181038.000|20110121181040.000|TR0|here in America.

20110121181043.000|20110121181045.000|TR0|That's why I met with Chinese leaders this 
20110121181045.000|20110121181047.000|TR0|week, and Jeff joined me at the state 
20110121181047.000|20110121181049.000|TR0|dinner.  During these meetings, we struck 
20110121181049.000|20110121181052.000|TR0|a deal to open Chinese markets to our 
20110121181052.000|20110121181054.000|TR0|products.  They're selling here, and 
20110121181054.000|20110121181056.000|TR0|that's fine, but we want to sell there.  
20110121181056.000|20110121181059.000|TR0|We want to open up their markets so that 
20110121181059.000|20110121181101.000|TR0|we got two-way trade, not just one-way 
20110121181101.000|20110121181103.000|TR0|trade.
20110121181103.000|20110121181105.000|TR0|

20110121181112.000|20110121181115.000|TR0|mean more than $45 billion in new business 
20110121181115.000|20110121181117.000|TR0|for American companies -- $45 billion. 
20110121181117.000|20110121181119.000|TR0|That translates into 235,000 new jobs for 
20110121181119.000|20110121181121.000|TR0|American workers.

20110121181318.000|20110121181320.000|TR0|in Samalkot means jobs in Schenectady.  
20110121181320.000|20110121181322.000|TR0|That's how we accelerate growth, that's

20110121181325.000|20110121181327.000|TR0|
20110121181327.000|20110121181329.000|TR0|This is how we go from an economy that was 
20110121181329.000|20110121181331.000|TR0|powered by what we borrow and what we 
20110121181331.000|20110121181334.000|TR0|consume -- that's what happened over the 
20110121181334.000|20110121181336.000|TR0|last 10 years.  What was driving our 
20110121181336.000|20110121181338.000|TR0|economy was we were spending a lot on 
20110121181338.000|20110121181340.000|TR0|credit cards.  Everybody was borrowing a 
20110121181340.000|20110121181343.000|TR0|lot.  The Chinese were selling a lot to 
20110121181343.000|20110121181345.000|TR0|us.  Folks were selling a lot to us from 
20110121181345.000|20110121181347.000|TR0|all over the world.  We've got to reverse 
20110121181347.000|20110121181350.000|TR0|that.  We want an economy that is fueled 
20110121181350.000|20110121181352.000|TR0|by what we invent and what we build.

20110121182054.000|20110121182056.000|TR0|
20110121182056.000|20110121182058.000|TR0|VELSHI: That's the president of the United 
20110121182058.000|20110121182101.000|TR0|States. He is shaking hands now with Jeff 
20110121182101.000|20110121182103.000|TR0|Immelt, the CEO of General Electric, at 
20110121182103.000|20110121182105.000|TR0|the birthplace of the company in 
20110121182105.000|20110121182107.000|TR0|Schenectady, New York. We have a lot of 
20110121182107.000|20110121182110.000|TR0|coverage of what he has done. This isn't 
20110121182110.000|20110121182112.000|TR0|just a speech about the economy. The 
20110121182112.000|20110121182114.000|TR0|president has just put Jeff Immelt in 
20110121182114.000|20110121182117.000|TR0|charge of a commission on competitiveness 
20110121182117.000|20110121182119.000|TR0|and jobs. He is looking to the head of one 
20110121182119.000|20110121182121.000|TR0|of America's greatest industries to try

20110121185208.000|20110121185210.000|TR0|thing.  Is this a business?
20110121185210.000|20110121185212.000|TR0|
20110121185212.000|20110121185215.000|TR0|SADOWSKY:  Well, it is a business, of 
20110121185215.000|20110121185217.000|TR0|course.  There's only one full-time 
20110121185217.000|20110121185219.000|TR0|employee right now, that's me.  The rest 
20110121185219.000|20110121185222.000|TR0|of the team definitely - they have day 
20110121185222.000|20110121185224.000|TR0|jobs.  They're doing things like working 
20110121185224.000|20110121185226.000|TR0|for JPL and they're working, teaching at 
20110121185226.000|20110121185228.000|TR0|universities and they are at think tanks 
20110121185228.000|20110121185231.000|TR0|and doing extraordinary work on their own.
20110121185231.000|20110121185233.000|TR0|
20110121185233.000|20110121185235.000|TR0|But they come to us to spend nights and 
20110121185235.000|20110121185238.000|TR0|weekends putting together things like this 
20110121185238.000|20110121185240.000|TR0|amazing Goldberg machine we did for "Okay, 
20110121185240.000|20110121185242.000|TR0|Go" or putting together -- making a car 
20110121185242.000|20110121185244.000|TR0|organ, an organ made literally out of cars 
20110121185244.000|20110121185247.000|TR0|that we did for a recent commercial for 
20110121185247.000|20110121185249.000|TR0|Die Hard batteries.
20110121185249.000|20110121185251.000|TR0|
20110121185251.000|20110121185254.000|TR0|VELSHI:  And where do you take this?  
20110121185254.000|20110121185256.000|TR0|Where do you go with this? Is this art?  
20110121185256.000|20110121185258.000|TR0|Is this solving problems in the world?  
20110121185258.000|20110121185300.000|TR0|What is it?
20110121185300.000|20110121185303.000|TR0|
20110121185303.000|20110121185305.000|TR0|BUSHNELL:  We've had this overarching goal 
20110121185305.000|20110121185307.000|TR0|to make technology accessible.  We want to 
20110121185307.000|20110121185309.000|TR0|inspire kids to go into science and 
20110121185309.000|20110121185312.000|TR0|engineering.  We know the world needs 
20110121185312.000|20110121185314.000|TR0|that.  We know the U.S. needs that.  We 
20110121185314.000|20110121185316.000|TR0|think if we can be a bunch of geeks that 
20110121185316.000|20110121185319.000|TR0|have a blast playing with fire and 
20110121185319.000|20110121185321.000|TR0|electricity and what not and can inspire 
20110121185321.000|20110121185323.000|TR0|some kids to do the same, we'll feel like 
20110121185323.000|20110121185325.000|TR0|we've succeed.
20110121185325.000|20110121185328.000|TR0|
20110121185328.000|20110121185330.000|TR0|SADOWSKY:  Yes, that's right.  As our 
20110121185330.000|20110121185332.000|TR0|co-founder has said, art is very much a 
20110121185332.000|20110121185335.000|TR0|reflection of ever the tools at the time.  
20110121185335.000|20110121185337.000|TR0|Technology is ever prevalent in our 
20110121185337.000|20110121185339.000|TR0|society today, and we're taking advantage

20110121185535.000|20110121185538.000|TR0|Birds" because it reflects your life in a 
20110121185538.000|20110121185540.000|TR0|way, yet told through the eyes of teenaged 
20110121185540.000|20110121185542.000|TR0|girls.
20110121185542.000|20110121185545.000|TR0|

20110121185549.000|20110121185551.000|TR0|was afraid of kind of glamorizing the 
20110121185551.000|20110121185554.000|TR0|violence and everything.  I didn't want to

20110121185558.000|20110121185600.000|TR0|story about two 15-year- old girls and the 
20110121185600.000|20110121185603.000|TR0|last five days of their friendship, and
